title: Il Molino di Grace 2008 Il Margone Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of stewed plum, leafy underbrush, scorched earth and leather. The palate offers dried black cherry, white pepper, clove and tobacco set against bracing, tightly knit tannins. Give the tannins another year or two to unwind then drink up to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Grayson 2014 Lot 11 Chardonnay (California)
description: A lush, medium-bodied wine with an extroverted personality, this starts with aromas like butter, vanilla and toasted baguette, then emphasizes ripe pear and yellow-peach flavors. A soft texture and lingering finish completes the picture.

title: Kirkland Signature 2010  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Garnet colored with a light brick rim, this opens with aromas of leafy underbrush, leather and a whiff of menthol. The palate is straightforward for a Brunello and already surprisingly accessible, offering dried wild cherry, licorice and a hint of baking spice alongside ripe tannins.

title: Foundry 2012 The Crucible Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of 94% Merlot with 3% Zinfandel and 3% Petit Verdot—a commingling not often seen, but one that in this case works. Blackberry and black currant rise to the occasion, along with a bite of fig, the wine structured in herb with a knock of cedar and gunpowder on the juicy finish.

title: Francis Blanchet 2014 Calcite  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This rounded, smooth wine will be delicious to drink. It is full of crisp white fruits, laced with lemon acidity while having a full, ripe character. From clay and chalk soil, it is forward, fruity and ready to drink now.

title: Lakewood 2014 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: From nose to finish, there's a distinctly floral tone to this vibrant, delicately framed Riesling. Dry in style, it offsets fresh, cutting grapefruit and tangerine flavors against perfumed notes of potpourri and talcum powder. Drink now through 2019.

title: Leaping Horse 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: A spicy, nicely oaky aroma catches the attention right away. Next, equally oak-influenced flavors like vanilla and cinnamon complement solid pear and crisp apple notes. This has good complexity and makes a fine example of a well-oaked Chardonnay.

title: Lincourt 2013 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Baked black plums and mission figs mix with lavender and cracked pepper on the nose of this cool-climate bottling. The palate shows tart boysenberry flavors along with black peppercorns and condensed violets.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2014 Origine  (Sancerre)
description: A perfumed wine, this has light tannins and fresh berry fruits. It is ripe with a fragrant floral character that's enhanced by the acidity and pure cherry flavors. The wine can be drunk now, but will be better from 2017.

title: Domaine Roger Champault 2014 Le Clos de la Cure  (Menetou-Salon)
description: This is a soft, ripe wine, smoothly textured. It has a good balance between the crisp apple and pear flavors and a more mineral texture that gives a bite. It's young, and great to drink now, although it will be even better from late 2016.

title: Jean-Max Roger 2014 Cuvée La Grange Dimière Rosé (Sancerre)
description: An perfumed wine, this is light and fruity. Bright raspberry flavors are lifted by refreshing acidity and a tang of zesty lemon. A touch of minerality gives texture. Drink now.

title: Jean-Max Roger 2014 Cuvée Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)
description: Coming from a classic limestone vineyard, this is tense, structured and tight. It is textured, with spice and tangy acidity giving some complexity to the otherwise fruity wine. Drink from 2017.

title: Joseph Mellot 2014 La Chatellenie  (Sancerre)
description: This 900-foot-high vineyard produces wines that are flinty, mineral and tight. With its textured character and zesty lemon notes, this wine is fresh yet still developing. Plenty of fruitiness will explode in the next few months. Drink after 2016.

title: Meyer Family Vineyards 2013 Tribute Series Pat Quinn Chardonnay (Okanagan Valley)
description: Lemon peel, grapefruit and yellow apples constitute the fruit here, with minimal impact from aging in 20% new French oak. The wine is stylish and the acid-driven flavors penetrating. It's a fine food wine.

title: Midnight 2012 Starlight Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: Rich and spicy on the nose, this wine offers aromas of clove-laced cherry-pie filling. The mouthfeel is soft and the flavors are straightforward, with plush blackberry fruit, dark chocolate, licorice and a minty lift on the finish.

title: Miracle Hill 2012 Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Thick and rich, this is a wine of breadth and depth, yeasty in baked bread and ripe in fresh raspberry. The proceedings are accented in Asian spice and black pepper through the finish.

title: Apriori 2014 Sangiacomo Vineyard Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from 68% Pinot Noir and 32% Syrah, this ethereal wine is pillowy in candied aromas of lemon and lime. Pinkish-copper in color, it's light, bright and succulent, and then finishes dry and with brevity.

title: Atwater 2013 Moffett Block Blaufränkisch (Finger Lakes)
description: Bold, penetrating tannins and bright cranberry acidity lend a tight frame to this classically styled Blaufränkisch, a.k.a. Lemberger. Crisp-tart blackberry and blueberry flavors are accented by bramble and herb notes that linger long on the finish. Its quite closed now, but should show well after 2018.

title: August Ridge 2010 Jovial Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 68% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Merlot hits the nose with aromas of brick, uncrushed clove, red cherries, wet gravel, rosewater and a touch of tobacco. The palate is surprisingly light, but packs cedar, pipesmoke, clove and nutmeg against a red cherry and cranberry backdrop.

title: Bella Luna 2011 Estate Riserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Templeton Gap District)
description: Though billed as a Super Tuscan, this is an odd but refreshing wine for those seeking something different. The Cab-Sangio blend offers strong black pepper, brambleberry, pink peppercorns and a touch of pasilla chile on the underripe nose. The palate is light in body but full of bright cranberry fruit and intriguing herbals, led by green peppercorns.

title: Belpoggio 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Aromas suggesting mature plum, scorched earth, clove, menthol and a hint of iris lead the nose. The ripe, one-dimensional palate offers mature black cherry, raspberry jam and cooking spice alongside fine-grained but not very persistent tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Villa di Geggiano 2011  Chianti Classico
description: This opens with aromas of mature wild cherry and pressed violet while the straightforward, juicy palate offers fleshy black cherry and a note of ground pepper. It's round and ready, with supple tannins.

title: Villa Le Prata 2010 Massimo Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This hearty red opens with aromas of toast, coffee bean, ripe plum, leather and a dash of menthol. The warm, robust palate offers dried black cherry marinated in spirits, raisin, licorice and espresso alongside dusty tannins that dry out the finish. Showing the heat of the vintage, it's already evolved, with evident alcohol that throws it off-balance.

title: Manzoni 2014 North Highlands Cuvee Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tight and minerally aromas of gray slate and river stones meet with light and delicate scents of daffodil and nectarine blossoms that take some effort to coax from the glass. The palate is high-toned with lime zest and lemon-juice acidity, opening steadily toward blanched Marcona almonds and toast.

title: Casaloste 2010 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of mature plum, toast, coconut, oak-driven spice and a whiff of game come together in the glass. The dense, rather evolved palate shows dried blackberry, licorice, coffee and vanilla alongside grainy tannins. The fruit is starting to dry up so drink soon.

title: Castoro Cellars 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh and bright aromas of blackberry pastry and black-cherry fruit show on the nose of this wine from a longtime Paso producer. There are tart tannins on the palate, with red-cherry flavors enhanced by turned black earth, dried mint and dill.

title: Château de Santenay 2012  Mercurey
description: Earthy and rustic, this intensely tannic wine has a dry character. The fruit is all there, hiding behind this rough exterior. Allow the wine time to soften out and drink from 2018.

title: Château du Petit Thouars 2011 Cuvée Réserve Cabernet Franc (Touraine)
description: Produced in western Touraine, close to Chinon and its red wines, this soft wine is ready to drink. With its smoky character and jammy fruit flavors, it is very much a light, perfumed Cabernet Franc. The aftertaste is dry, although the fruit is always there.

title: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Bacchus Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of char and toast are quite up front, though they smooth out over time and give way to lemon meringue. The tropical fruit, butter and spice flavors are broad and well balanced, with a creamy feel and a lingering finish. The oak gets out front, but there are good things going on.

title: Cosentino 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Chocolate-wrapped stogie comes to mind aromatically and in terms of taste in this reserve wine, which is otherwise roundly voluptuous. Peppercorn, cedar and plum mingle on the palate before a tannic finish closes things out.
